name: Hairdresser's Invisible Oil Hydrating Hair Mask
categories: Hair, Hair Styling & Treatments, Hair Masks
about: What it is:\ A hydrating weekly hair mask that reduces frizz and nourishes hair. Leaves your hair hydrated for up to 72 hours – for shiny, smooth, soft strands...Hair Type: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Texture: Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily..Hair Concerns:- Dryness.- Straightening/Smoothing.- Frizz..Key Benefits:\ - Hydrating.- Reduces frizz.- Heat protection..Formulation: Cream..Highlighted Ingredients:- Featherlight 6-Oil Blend: Provides conditioning, moisture, nourishment, softening, and smoothing..- Moringa Oil and Pomegranate Seed Extract: Provide moisture...Ingredient Callouts: Free of sulfates SLS and SLES, parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, and mineral oil. This product is also vegan, cruelty-free, and gluten-free...What Else You Need to Know: Infused with a signature blend of six featherlight plant oils and boosted with moringa oil and pomegranate seed extract, this moisture-rich mask tames frizz, detangles, and protects against breakage...Fragrance Description:\ Take in this luxe yet light scent of fruit and tropical florals, anchored with rich musk and woodsy notes...Clinical Results: Provides 72 hours of hair hydration
ingredients: -Signature Six-Oil Blend: Conditions, softens, and adds shine..-Moringa Oil and Pomegranate Seed Extract: Provide moisture....WaterAquaEau, Cetearyl Alcohol, Distearyldimonium Chloride, Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Propanediol, Dimethicone, Behenyl Alcohol, Behentrimonium Chloride, Cetyl Esters, Gardenia Taitensis (Tiare) Flower Extract, Carthamus Tinctorius (Safflower) Seed Oil, Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis (Sweet Almond) Oil, Vitis Vinifera (Grape) Seed Oil, Macadamia Integrifolia Seed Oil, Argania Spinosa Kernel Oil, Moringa Oleifera Seed Oil, Punica Granatum (Pomegranate) Sterols, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Tocopherol, Lactic Acid, Dimethiconol, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Hydroxypropyl Guar, Arginine, Fragrance (Parfum), Linalool, Butylphenyl Methylpropional, Hexyl Cinnamal, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol....Please be aware that ingredient lists may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product package you receive for the most up to date list of ingredients.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-After shampooing, pop the flip-top and apply to damp hair..-Leave on for three to five minutes..-Rinse..-Use weekly..-For fine to medium hair, apply a quarter-size amount from mid-shafts to ends..-For medium to coarse/thick hair, apply a palm-size amount from roots to ends. Use enough to saturate the hair..-To use as a pre-poo, apply to dry hair, leave on for five minutes, then rinse..-For a richer consistency, add a few drops of Hairdresser‘s Invisible Oil (sold separately) to the mask..-Leave on for up to 20 minutes for extra-dry hair.

reviews.review_title: It's A Nice Mask, But SO Over-Priced
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Good: I genuinely enjoyed using this product. I have fine very naturally curly hair that can sometimes be frizzy and unruly. It literally takes a village (of products) to tame this mane sometimes. I feel like this mask added a nice bounce to my natural curls and it also provided a good level of hydration and nourishment without leaving my hair oily like many hair masks which target frizz and include oil in them can do. I really like the way my hair feels after this and I never have a bad hair day after this mask.  The Bad: As much as I like this product, I have a lot of other hair masks that I've been able to compare this to and honestly, there's even better masks out there that perform to a higher standard than this mask does. On top of that, they're a lot cheaper.   The Ugly/Honest: For a hair mask, this doesn't have the standard amount of product (which is usually 8 oz). I much more enjoy the results of CurlSmith Hydro Creme and thats $29/8oz or the SheaMoisture Manuka Honey that goes for $13.99/12 oz. I got this as a free product and despite enjoying it I just can't justify repurchasing it for $43/6.7 oz. Overall, I'd give the product itself 4 stars but I need to take off a star for the price gouging because in my opinion, the price point does not match the performance level.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'd give this a zero if I could and I'm really hoping I got a dud. There are such better products out there that are way less expensive. I used points to get a sample of this and I was excited--I have in the past liked B&B's products, even if I don't use them on the regular. The typical hair mask I use is from It's A 10, so I compare all other masks to this by default. I have naturally blonde hair that falls to the top of my hips--so while it's thinner, there is a TON of it and the ends need extra care. I was pleased that the sample was quite big so even I could get two uses out of it (hahaha!) and that's where my pleasant experience abruptly ended. The goop out of the package felt like sticky melted plastic and stupidly I put it on my hair hoping that would somehow change it's state, which it didn't. My hair felt like melted plastic as I waited the 5 min as per instructed. It didn't want to rise out, so I had to work hard to really rinse my hair thoroughly. My damp hair felt awful to the touch, snarly, not soft, plastic-y. Took forever for my hair to air dry (8 hours--are you kidding me?). Now that my hair is dry I'm ready for another shower because my hair looks and feels like Barbie hair and that is not a look. It's slightly better than hay, and honestly my hair sans conditioner of any sort would be better off. Hard NOPE on this one!
